As far as pew pew games go, there's nothing like a classic pew pew in CS GO. Not quite as good as CS1.6, it still fills me with nostalgia, and memories of back in the day when I wasn't an old fart, had reflexes, could shoot straight, and didn't throw the mouse in the air when a terrorist with an AK47 nails me from behind with a fright kill.

Some interesting and fun variations, like deathmatch, and the bouncy maps where everyone gets a box-camping-hoe sniper rifle. Just a note, bots on expert are manageable, even if you're rusty and a bit slow like me. However, once you get online, the acidity level gets very high, and you will be shot through doors, boxes, smoke, flashbangs and that's while you're still buying your first gun.

Despite being almost as old as me, CS GO is still great pew pew fun. Unless you get online, and ask what's the command to show latency, and you're told Alt F4. But this is the life of online gamers isn't it?

Pew Pew away, and remember, a knife to the back is worth two grenades in a bush.
